'Upgrades your dependencies to the latest version according to composer.json, and updates the composer.lock file.'
'Packages that should be updated, if not provided all packages are.'
'Forces installation from package sources when possible, including VCS information.'
'Forces installation from package dist even for dev versions.'
'Outputs the operations but will not execute anything (implicitly enables --verbose).'
'Enables installation of require-dev packages (enabled by default, only present for BC).'
'Only updates the lock file hash to suppress warning about the lock file being out of date.'
'Skips the execution of all scripts defined in composer.json file.'
'Add also dependencies of allowed packages to the allow list, except those defined in root package.'
'Add also all dependencies of allowed packages to the allow list, including those defined in root package.'
'Shows more details including new commits pulled in when updating packages.'
'Autoload classes from the classmap only. Implicitly enables `--optimize-autoloader`.'
'Interactive interface with autocompletion to select the packages to update.'
'Restricts the update to your first degree dependencies.'
The <info>update</info> command reads the composer.json file from the
current directory, processes it, and updates, removes or installs all the
To limit the update operation to a few packages, you can list the package(s)
you want to update as such:
You may also use an asterisk (*) pattern to limit the update operation to package(s)
To select packages names interactively with auto-completion use <info>-i</info>.
'<warning>You are using the deprecated option "no-custom-installers". Use "no-plugins" instead.</warning>'
'<warning>You are using the deprecated option "dev". Dev packages are installed by default now.</warning>'
'--interactive cannot be used in non-interactive terminals.'
'<info>Press enter without value to end submission</info>'
'Would you like to continue and update the above package%s [<comment>yes</comment>]? '
